703838f-b.title: Brooklyn: Court Street - Joralemon Street
703838f-b.text:
(1)
Court Street, west side, north from JJoralemon Street. At right, ]  is the Borough Hall Park. The building in the left center being de-
molished, is the Garfield Building: rased in 1925. It was built in 1881,]  and was one of the earliest office buildings of Brooklyn.
May 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, viewed from across Borough Hall Park. At the left, is
the stepa leading into the Borough Hall Building. In the foreground, is
a pillar of the Fulton Elevated Lines. of the B.M.T.
May 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
703838f-b.folder: Court Street & Joralemon Street, Brooklyn, NY

703840f-a.title: Brooklyn: Court Street - Joralemon Street
703840f-a.text:
(1)
M2-44 Court Street, west side, near Joralemon Street, showing an
interior of the Hamilton Bilding about 1900. It stood on the site of
the present Temple Bar Building.
About 1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAO BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, showing a bridge on the second floor, connecting the two
Hamilton buildings.
About 1900.
Eugene L, Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
t3)
The same, shoaing a stairway in the building.
About 1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(4)
The same, another view.
About 1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

703837f-a.title: Brooklyn: Court Street - Joralemon Street
703837f-a.text:
Court Street, east side, south from Joralemon to Liv-
ingston Streets. In the foregrouno is the Washington
Building, erected about 1851 and torn down in 1924, behind
which is a small municipal park. The building with the
sloping roof is the Brooklyn Polytechnic Institute on Liv-
ingston Street. The Washington Building and the three
builcings contiguous to it were later torn down and the
Muunicipal Building erected on the site. The other struc-
tures are still standing in 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection  View 1: 1914
MAY BE REPRODUCED  View 2: 1922

703841f-a.title: Brooklyn: Court Street - Joralemon Street
703841f-a.text:
44 Court Street, at the N.W. corner of Joralemon Street.  A view of
the HBamilton Building; the site is now occupied by the Temple Bar Building.
About 1910.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
